etymons.meaning: stark, kräftig, mächtig sein oder werden

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: qay abri? hawi gušmux qawi w hawi foṯux saməq 617; 76/140; hano ġắlabe qawi b-lebe ḏ̣əd d-aloho hul dáraǧe, d-ko-mankər u=wuǧūd d-aloho
translations: wieso denn, mein Sohn? Ist denn dein Körper nicht schon kräftig und dein Gesicht frisch rot geworden?
‘He was strongly disaffected against God to such an extent that he denied the very existence of God’; 43/6 [MT]

Infectum.turoyo: balki qowe əšmo 617; 76/133; kət-lan arwono g-nəḥrina-le saymina-le qaliyo w-gəd-muklina-le l-u=zʕur-ano balki qowe əšmo w-gušme miʕadəl
translations: vielleicht wird er dann ein wenig kräftig

‘We have a calf. We are going to slaughter it and prepare a piece of meat from it and we are going to feed it to the boy. Perhaps he will get a bit stronger, and his body will be in a good condition’ 76/133;

Preterit.turoyo: ʕal d-maqwele foṯe ġắlabe, ašər, mḥéli-le lakmo ʕal foṯe 617; 43/53; ono… maqweli lebi116/32yawmo həngi maqwele ʕal u=babo omər adyawma lo=k-owe illa g-əzzino qm-aʕ=ʕeze ono w-hat g-məṯnoḥəthat maqwelux aʕli b-u=šeyolo w-hul d-məllilux u=mede d-kət-wa b-lebi
translations: Since he was very importunate, sure I gave him a slap in the face
‘One day he pestered his father, saying: “Today I am certainly going with the goats, and you are going to take a rest” 75/52;
‘You have pestered me with questions to the point that I told what was on my mind’ 82/37;

Infectum.turoyo: Omar: “Hul d kətno saġ (gmaqweno ak qawetyatayḏi ʕal ann abnayḏi stene) tark didux lǝgbǝn (= lobǝn). Towat hat waziro, hul d kətna saġ, towat waziro hat.”
translations: He said: “As long as I am alive..., I will commit my instructions [by means of testament] also to my sons, they will not leave you [lit.: give your leaving]. You shall be vizier, as long as we are alive, you shall be vizier.”
